nodes.title: Privacy Week - Tuesday - Blog 4

nodes.description: As quantum computing continues to mature, research and development efforts in cryptography are keeping pace. We're optimistic that collaborative efforts among NIST, Microsoft, Cloudflare, and other computing companies will yield a robust, standards-based solution.

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Friday - Post Quantum
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
nodes.description: As quantum computing continues to mature, research and development efforts in cryptography are keeping pace. We're working with academia and industry peers to help create a new set of cryptography standards that are resilient to attack from quantum computers.

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Friday - Encrypting WAF Payloads with HPKE
nodes.resourceTitle: Encrypting your WAF Payloads with Hybrid Public Key Encryption (HPKE)
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
nodes.description: Allowing logging for payloads that trigger the Firewall has always led to end user privacy concerns. We built encrypted matched payload logging to solve this!

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Friday - Local Law
nodes.resourceTitle: How to Build a Global Network that Complies with Local Law
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
nodes.description: Running a global network that complies with different privacy laws around the world requires coming back to the values that we have championed since our founding: Being principled and transparent, respecting privacy, requiring due process, and providing customers with notice so that they can make their own decisions about their data.

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Thursday - Certifications
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
nodes.description: We think trust is fundamental to building a better Internet. Cloudflare adheres to industry standard security compliance certifications and regulations to help our customers earn their users' trust.

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Thursday - Workplace Records for Teams

topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
nodes.description: Workplace Records uses Access and Gateway logs to provide the state and country from which employees are working. Workplace Records can be used to help finance, legal, and HR departments determine where payroll taxes are due and provide an auditable record to defend those decisions.

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Wednesday - cookie
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
nodes.description: Cloudflare is deprecating the cfduid cookie. While we have never never tracked end-users or sell their data, we don't want any customer to think they need a cookie banner because of what we do.

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Wednesday - Web - Analytics

topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Tuesday - ODoH
nodes.resourceTitle: Improving DNS Privacy with Oblivious DoH in 1.1.1.1
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
nodes.description: Oblivious DoH (ODoH) makes secure DNS over HTTPS (DoH) queries into private queries which prevent the leakage of client IP addresses to resolvers. The new proposed ODoH standard addresses this problem and today we are enabling users to use this protocol with 1.1.1.1

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Tuesday - ECH
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Tuesday - Next-Gen-Protocols

topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
nodes.description: Encryption is the foundation of security and privacy on the Internet. Today, we are announcing our work on advancing industry standardization on privacy, including Oblivious DNS over HTTPS, Encrypted Client Hello, and OPAQUE password-less authentication.

nodes.title: Privacy Week - Tuesday - OPAQUE
nodes.resourceTitle: OPAQUE: The Best Passwords Never Leave your Device
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
nodes.description: Imagine passwords for online services that never leave your device, encrypted or otherwise. OPAQUE is a new cryptographic protocol that makes this idea possible, giving you and only you full control of your password.

nodes.title: Cloudflare DDoS Insights for Israel
nodes.description:
In the past quarter, DDoS attacks targeting Israel increased by 400%. Simultaneously, DDoS attacks on both government and private sectors increased to an all-time high in the region and Ransom DDoS attacks surged globally. In the Ukraine-Russia cyberspace, DDoS attacks targeted broadcast media and banking companies as both application-layer and network-layer attacks surged by 72% and 109% respectively.

Cloudflare analyzes DDoS attacks that are detected and mitigated across our global network — spanning over 270 data centers worldwide — to uncover key patterns and insights into both known and emerging attack types.

Join this webinar to learn:

  • Which industries are getting hit the hardest in 2022, and by which attack vectors.
  • What is the Mantis botnet, what’s unique about it, and who it is attacking.
  • How to prepare and defend against Ransom DDoS attacks launched by “Fancy Lazarus” and other cyber espionage groups.

nodes.title: Product Chats: What's New for Zaraz & R2 (Mandarin)
nodes.description: Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including August's feature on Zaraz & R2.

nodes.title: LA DESAPARICIÓN DE LOS EQUIPOS DE HARDWARE DE RED
nodes.description:
La desaparición de los equipos de hardware de Red: ¿Por qué ha llegado el momento de dejar atrás el hardware de red?

Aunque el almacenamiento y la informática han migrado a la nube, muchas funciones de red permanecen en  entornos locales, limitando la capacidad y el soporte, generando fallos de seguridad y aumentando los costos.  

Más aún, la inflación y la escasez de chips están provocando retrasos masivos en pedidos de hardware de TI tradicional. Con el cambio a servicio, puedes liberarte de los retrasos en la cadena de suministros de hardware y solucionar inmediatamente las brechas de rendimiento y seguridad.

Acompáñanos al webinar LA DESAPARICIÓN DE LOS EQUIPOS DE HARDWARE DE RED donde explicaremos  por qué ha llegado el momento de dejar atrás el hardware de red a favor de optimizar la seguridad, la capacidad  tecnológica de las organizaciones y los costos asociados.

nodes.title: O fim dos dispositivos de hardware de rede
nodes.description:
O fim dos dispositivos de hardware de rede

Embora o armazenamento e a computação tenham migrado para a nuvem, muitas soluções para proteção de rede ainda funcionam em dispositivos físicos, limitando a capacidade e o suporte, criando brechas de segurança, consumindo investimentos e depreciando com o tempo. 

 

Além disso, atualmente, a inflação e a escassez de chips estão causando grandes atrasos nos pedidos de hardware de TI tradicionais. Ao mudar para o serviço na nuvem, você se livra desses atrasos em sua cadeia de suprimentos de hardware e resolve as lacunas de segurança e desempenho imediatamente.

 

Durante o webinar O fim dos dispositivos de hardware de rede no dia 18 de agosto, explicaremos por que chegou a hora de deixar o hardware de rede para trás e otimizar a segurança, a capacidade tecnológica das organizações e os custos associados.

nodes.description: EMEA: 3:00pm-4:00pm GMT // Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including August's feature on Zaraz & R2.

nodes.title: Product Roadmap: Presented by Stephanie Barnett, Head of Solution Engineering & Fernando Serto, Principal Architect and Evangelist (APJC)
nodes.description: Join our Head of Solution Engineering & Principal Architect and Evangelist, providing insight into what Cloudflare is building next and our upcoming technology improvements. This event is exclusively for Cloudflare Enterprise customers.

nodes.title: Turn fear into opportunity — 3 strategic steps to cloud transformation during economic uncertainty
nodes.description: Today organizations are facing economic uncertainty, shrinking budgets and lack of clarity on how to move their business forward. In this webinar, we will hear from Cloudflare CFO Thomas Siefert, and expand on the varying factors creating these circumstances and market conditions. From these insights, we define three steps leaders can take to align IT infrastructure strategy to the new economic environment.

nodes.title: Keep on top of your application security and protect your user data
nodes.description:
Web applications and APIs make the digital world go round. Cloudflare protects applications and APIs from abuse, stops bad bots, thwarts DDoS attacks, and monitors for suspicious payloads and browser supply chain attacks.

Cloudflare Page Shield protects your visitors from Magecart-style supply chain attacks that steal credit card information and sensitive data through malicious third-party dependencies.

In this live webinar, we will discuss the following topics:

  • The key update of Cloudflare new WAF
  • Introduction to Cloudflare Page Shield
  • Demos of key functions of WAF and Page Shield

We look forward to seeing you in this live webinar.

What challenges are solved with WAF?

nodes.description: AMER: Thursday, July 28th ⋅ 6:00 - 7:30pm PDT  // Join our SVP, Chief Product Officer & SVP, Emerging Technology & Incubation for a digital event, providing insight into what Cloudflare is building next and our upcoming technology improvements. This event is exclusively for Cloudflare Enterprise customers.

nodes.title: CF Connect London 2022 - Cloudflare Network
nodes.description:
We cover how Cloudflare built a global network platform that service millions of customers and billions of users with next-level performance and availability.
Key Products: CDN, DNS, Argo Smart Routing, DDoS, Images, Stream, Workers/R2, Magic Transit/WAN/Firewall
Adjacent Products: Zero Trust

nodes.title: APJC Zero Trust Demo - 101: An overview of Cloudflare Zero Trust
nodes.description: In this demo video, our experts will provide an overview of Cloudflare Zero Trust and every major service and offering within Cloudflare Zero Trust, including ZTNA, SWG, CASB, Remote Browser Isolation, and Area 1 (Email Security).

nodes.title: Is there a coming 'Phishpocalypse'?
nodes.description:
Deep language-based neural networks are surprisingly good at generating and detecting text of all forms.  Some AI labs have been hesitant to release the details of their models for fear that they would be used to spread fake news, spam, and disinformation.  What if they were used to generate phishing campaigns, for example? 

This talk will dive into the details of how phishing and spam emails can be created with these novel text generation neural-networks.  The talk will also explain how these kinds of emails can be identified and prevented.   

Join this talk to learn:

  • Background on neural networks in the security space
  • A primer on text generation using state-of-the-art neural networks
  • How phishing, spam, and malicious emails can be generated using these techniques.
  • Detection techniques for neural-network generated malicious emails

nodes.title: CF Connect London 2022 - Network Security-as-a-Service
nodes.description: This session covers how network security architectures have changed over time and how Internet-native security and DDoS protection can defend against advanced threats.

nodes.title: CF Connect London 2022 - Privacy on the Internet
nodes.description: Data protection worldwide presents unique challenges. In this session, we share our perspectives on how organizations can better address the GDPR and other regulations

nodes.title: Better business thanks to fewer bots (APAC)
nodes.description:
On any given day organizations should block at least a third of their web traffic that comes from malicious bots.  We know by now bots not only ruin web experiences for visitors but also carry out scraping attacks, credential and credit card stuffing, inventory hoarding to harm business.

Join Cloudflare and guest speaker Janet Worthington, a Forrester senior analyst, to understand current enterprise perspectives and techniques on stopping modern bots that can derail business.

In this webinar, you will learn about:

  • The current state of bots on the global internet
  • Key bot management trends in the enterprise
  • Key layers of bot defenses
  • Ways to stop bots and frustrate bot operators 
  • Our vision for a CAPTCHA-free internet

nodes.title: CF Connect London 2022 - Taking control of third-party tools
nodes.description: In this session we will discuss privacy concerns for third-party tools, detecting threats from third-party scripts in browsers, and solving other security challenges.

nodes.title: CF Connect London 2022 - Keeping APIs secure and productive
nodes.description: Growing API traffic powers businesses but also expands the attack surface. This session will cover API visibility challenges and tips to implement layered API defenses.

nodes.title: Cloudflare customer plans: Comparing Lite vs. Full Enterprise
nodes.description:
As Cloudflare customers scale their usage, their journey may start with a self-service plan. Their trajectory often then brings them to an Enterprise account. But did you know that there are two types of Enterprise plans? Are you familiar with the differences and aware of which tier your team is on?

Join this webinar to learn:

  • The benefits of starting with Enterprise-Lite
  • The three main reasons why customers decide to transition to Full Enterprise
  • A brief case study on a customer that has grown through our different plans and which plans have best supported their usage along the way

nodes.title: A new DDoS attack vector for volumetric attacks [APAC]
nodes.description:
A new zero-day vulnerability has been discovered that can be exploited to launch disruptive DDoS attacks using UDP amplification. This attack vector is in many ways more severe than memcached, allowing large scale reflection and amplification attacks to be launched against IP targets. Join this webinar where Cloudflare engineers will discuss the technique and defenses to protect your networks against amplification DDoS attacks.

In this webinar, you will learn about:

  • amplification DDoS attacks
  • how the zero-day vulnerability can be exploited
  • steps to protect your networks and telephony systems

nodes.title: How the Cloudflare security team stops phishing (APJC)
nodes.description:
Phishing continues to be one of the most frequent and expensive threats faced by organizations of all sizes. The FBI received around 324,000 phishing-related complaints and reported adjusted losses of $2.4 billion due to Business Email Compromise (BEC) attacks in 2021.

As a global company with more than 2,000 employees and 15 offices, Cloudflare faces the continual challenge of an expanding phishing attack surface. 

Join the Cloudflare security team in this session to:

  • See email security challenges faced by a global company with a remote and hybrid workforce
  • Learn from examples where attackers tried to socially engineer victims to steal money and data
  • Study the strengths and gaps of native email security from cloud email providers 
  • Get common success criteria used for evaluating anti-phishing solutions
  • Understand how a defense-in-depth strategy can help stop phishing and BEC

We will host a live Q&A at the end to answer all your questions about how to protect against phishing attacks.

nodes.title: Product Chats: What's New for Application Security & Page Shield (Mandarin)
nodes.description: APJC (Mandarin): Thursday,  June 30 10:00 AM CST // Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including June's feature on Application Security & Page Shield.

nodes.title: Taking control of third-party tools
nodes.description:
Websites typically run a plethora of tools and widgets for analytics, marketing automation, advertising, chatbots, security, and social media. These third-party tools can adversely impact the performance of websites and they also increase the attack surface, posing security risks to the organization. Moreover, organizations have limited/no visibility and control over the data that third party tools access, leading to privacy concerns.  

In this session, we will discuss:

  • Privacy concerns related to third-party tools
  • Performance and Security challenges of third-party JavaScript
  • Detecting elusive threats from third-party scripts in end-users’ browsers
  • Removing third-party scripts from the browser and loading them on the cloud

nodes.title: The evolution of Cloudflare One
nodes.description:
At Cloudflare, we think the underlying platform powering a SASE framework is just as important as the distinct Zero Trust security and networking capabilities provided. Our global network keeps growing and our platform capabilities are always evolving, helping our customers modernize their security and transform their corporate networks.

Join us in this webinar for a recap of recent updates to Cloudflare One and a review of the current state of our platform. We’ll discuss:

  • Newer areas of our portfolio like email security, API-driven CASB, and DLP
  • Additional use cases we can now address with our ZTNA, SWG, and RBI services
  • Integrations we’re building between several of our products to make them even more powerful
  • Updates to our network services portfolio

nodes.title: Acelere sua jornada Zero Trust
nodes.description:
Acelere sua jornada Zero Trust

Modernizar a segurança é fundamental. Nossas redes não podem mais se estender aos aplicativos que residem em nuvem e às equipes que trabalham remotamente, além de ameaças cibernéticas permanentes. 

A equipe da Cloudflare consulta organizações em todo o mundo sobre suas estratégias de modernização de segurança.

Durante este webinar, os executivos da Cloudflare compartilharão perspectivas sobre como acelerar e preparar sua abordagem de segurança para o futuro com casos de uso específicos em torno do conceito de Zero Trust.

nodes.description: APJC: Wednesday,  June 22 3:00 PM SGT // Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including June's feature on Application Security & Page Shield.

nodes.title: 未来を守る - Zero Trustでビジネスの変革をより迅速に
nodes.description:
新型コロナウィルス感染症の大流行で、突然、リモートワークへの移行を余儀なくされた企業は、従業員がインターネットへ接続できる環境を確保するために奔走しました。企業はVPNアプライアンスの容量増加、スプリットトンネリングの導入といったごく一般的なアプローチで対応したものの、可視性、セキュリティ、複雑さといったこれまでにもよく見られた課題に直面するにつれ、こうしたアプローチはすぐにほころびを見せ始めました。 

リモートワークのセキュリティアプローチで見つかった欠陥を解消するために、数週間、数ヶ月と長い時間をかけるべきではありません。 

本日ご紹介するプレゼンテーションでは、セキュアアクセスサービスエッジ（SASE）、Cloudflare Oneに対しCloudflareの提示する解決策を詳しく解説します。ネットワーク接続サービスとZero Trustセキュリティサービスを、目的別に構築されたグローバルネットワークで融合する手法についてご覧いただけます。 

Cloudflareは今回のプレゼンテーションでSASEの概念を探るとともに、SASEの導入、展開を計画するIT調達担当者に役立つ戦略を深く掘り下げます。内容：

  • Cloudflareの概要 
  • CloudflareのZero TrustプラットフォームであるCloudflare Oneのアーキテクチャ
  • Zero Trustの主要なユースケース
  • ビジネスを変革するためにZero Trustを取り入れるステップ

nodes.title: Acelera tu recorrido a Zero Trust
nodes.description:
Acelera tu recorrido a Zero Trust

Este es un momento crucial para modernizar la seguridad. Nuestras redes ya no pueden abarcar aplicaciones ubicadas en la nube, equipos trabajando remotamente y lidiar al mismo tiempo con amenazas cibernéticas constantes.

En este webinar, ejecutivos de Cloudflare compartirán cómo acelerar y asegurar un enfoque de seguridad preparado para el futuro con casos de uso específicos sobre Zero Trust.

También nos acompañarán clientes que compartirán su experiencia trabajando con las soluciones de Zero Trust de Cloudflare.

nodes.title: Keeping tabs on third party client-side security risks
nodes.description:
While third party scripts make developers’ lives easier, how do you track their behaviors and know if they become compromised? The risk of client-side, Magecart-style attacks is real, as attackers look to compromise the dozens of third party dependencies running on a site to target web visitors’ sensitive information.

Join this session to learn how Cloudflare can help your business stay safe from malicious third party script security risks.

nodes.title: Magic WAN: Simplifying WAN architecture for a hybrid work future (APJC)
nodes.description:
The Internet is your new corporate network with users working from home and most SaaS applications delivered over the Internet. What does this mean for the traditional enterprise WAN? How do you use the Internet securely to keep your users and data safe?

While frameworks like SASE are helping enterprises navigate this transformation, you can take some concrete steps today to ensure security for your employees and partners. In this webinar, we will show how Magic WAN and Cloudflare One can help you simplify your WAN, use the Internet safely, and enforce consistent security policies across in-office and remote users.

Join this webinar to:

  • Learn about evolving WAN requirements and the SASE framework
  • Discover more about Cloudflare One architecture with network security built-in
  • Watch a demo of Cloudflare Magic WAN and network security configuration

nodes.title: Improving Data Privacy on the Internet
nodes.description:
The Internet was not built with privacy or security in mind. The people who first designed and built it were primarily concerned with connecting a trusted group of people, with no appreciation that it would come to power the global economy and become one of our primary means of communication and access to information. In recent years, however, privacy on the Internet has taken on a central role. And last year's Schrems II decision brought into stark relief concerns about government surveillance and cross-border data transfers -- in the EU and globally. Gone are the days when all the world’s data could be processed in a massive data center regardless of its provenance.

One reaction to this change could be a retreat into every country building its own Internet. We think a better answer to this privacy challenge is the same as the answer to the connectivity and security phases of the Internet: build it! We need to build a privacy-respecting Internet and give companies the tools to easily build privacy-respecting applications. This session will address how we can build privacy-enhancing technologies that keep data private regardless of jurisdiction.

nodes.title: DDoS attack trends and predictions for 2022
nodes.description:
DDoS attacks dominated the headlines in 2021, targeting critical infrastructure and telephone systems, and played a major role in the ransomware crisis. Attackers continue to evolve their techniques and targets, with new vulnerabilities adding more ammunition to their arsenal. How vulnerable is your organisation and how can you ensure your external-facing network infrastructure is protected in 2022?

In this webinar, we will examine the latest DDoS attack trends seen on the Cloudflare network platform, as well as discuss new vulnerabilities announced this year, and the steps needed to mitigate them.

  • New attack techniques and targets this year
  • DDoS trends and predictions for 2022
  • Mitigation steps organisations can take to proactively defend against DDoS attack

이 모바일 시대에는 이미지와 시각 자료로 사용자 경험이 개선되기는 하지만, 사용자의 페이지 속도에 영향이 미치지는 않을까요? 이런 경우 조직에서는 웹 기반 응용 프로그램과 모바일 응용 프로그램에 이미지를 활용할 때 품질과 성능 중 하나를 선택해야만 하는 기로에 설 때가 많습니다.

이 제품 채팅 세션에는 Cloudflare 응용 프로그램 서비스 중 두 가지 핵심 서비스인 Cloudflare Images와 WAF를 소개합니다. 이 세션은 Cloudflare를 처음 접하는 분과 최신 혁신 정보의 업데이트를 원하는 기존 고객 모두에게 유익합니다. 

​​​​​​​

nodes.title: Building a Serverless Video Streaming Pipeline
nodes.description:
Over the last two years, live and on-demand video streaming has been critical for high-growth businesses and creators to connect with their customers worldwide. However, building reliable video experiences for a global audience can be daunting.

Join our webinar with Zaid Farooqui and Apoorva Ravikrishnan from Cloudflare to learn about building and scaling a serverless video pipeline.

In this webinar, you will learn about:

  1. The state of video streaming
  2. How companies are succeeding with video streaming
  3. Four critical challenges when building video experiences 
  4. How to cut your time to market from months to week with serverless video streaming
  5. Reducing long term technical debt while lowering infrastructure costs

nodes.title: The Fundamentals of Network Security-as-a-Service
nodes.description:
Security has historically been bolted onto traditional network architectures as an afterthought. With the shift to everything-as-a-service, legacy security appliances can become bottlenecks to scale and agility. Perimeter-based security models require all network traffic to trombone through specific Internet exit points, impacting SaaS application performance. Security needs to evolve from a bottleneck to an enabler for the next wave of digital transformation. Our experts will be covering the fundamentals of network SECaaS in this new webinar.

Join us to learn:

  • What network security-as-a-service is.
  • How cloud-native network security-as-a-service can help increase your operational agility and improve application performance.
  • Steps you can take to evolve your network security through zero-trust.

nodes.title: Powerful Tools in Building your SOC: Cloudflare & Google Cloud Chronicle
nodes.description:
Cloud Computing is not a new word in the IT industry as it has been there for many years now. Since the onset of the pandemic, the world has been seeing many enterprises adopt cloud computing on their core business operations. In particular, it piqued people's interest in cybersecurity, while some even thought of setting up SOC on their own.

In this webinar, we have gathered two (2) powerful tools: Cloudflare protects the enetrprises from cyberattacks AND Google Chronicle makes use of the security information collected by Cloudflare to provide further data analysis on threat detection, compliance and security incident management.  

Join us and discover how:
1. Cloudflare helps in mitigating cyberattacks while also providing more visibility on your traffic
2. AI SIEM provides smart visualisation 
3. Cloudflare & Google Chronicle help to maximise your SOC

nodes.title: Convergence of the WAN and the Edge: Key strategies to deliver fast, secure, and reliable online experiences over the modern network
nodes.description:
The last decade witnessed a significant shift in application deployment — from bare metal on-premises to serverless edge compute. A similar shift is underway in WAN architectures — from legacy hub-and-spoke MPLS to cloud-native network-as-a-service. 

But with the rise of low-latency use cases (such as, financial trading, online gaming, and live video) and ever-increasing customer expectations, what strategies should IT buyers adopt to deliver seamless end-user experiences and drive better business outcomes?

In this webinar, guest speaker Ghassan Abdo, IDCs Research VP, of WW Telecom, Virtualization & CDN will explore the top trends in Managed Edge Services, its role in enabling digital transformation for enterprises, and key considerations for IT buyers when selecting an edge services provider.

nodes.title: DDoS attack trends and predictions for 2022
nodes.description:
DDoS attacks dominated the headlines in 2021, targeting critical infrastructure and telephone systems, and played a major role in the ransomware crisis. Attackers continue to evolve their techniques and targets, with new vulnerabilities adding more ammunition to their arsenal. How vulnerable is your organization and how can you ensure your external-facing network infrastructure is protected in 2022?

In this webinar, Cloudflare experts will be joined by Doug Madory, Director of Internet Analysis at Kentik, to examine the latest DDoS attack trends seen on the Cloudflare network platform, as well as discuss new vulnerabilities announced this year, and the steps needed to mitigate them. 

Join this webinar to learn about:

  • New attack techniques and targets this year
  • DDoS trends and predictions for 2022
  • Mitigation steps organizations can take to proactively defend against DDoS attacks

nodes.title: The biggest application attacks of 2022 - and the modern defenses to stop them
nodes.description:
We have moved well beyond the familiar OWASP top ten attacks of the past to now witness attackers exploit global vulnerabilities, target APIs often with bots.  Bots make up close to 40 percent of traffic and now demand dedicated security to keep them from overwhelming sites.

We’ll examine insights about application attacks in 2022 from the vantage point of our network and show the integrated security necessary to keep this broad array of attacks from slowing business or distracting IT teams.

nodes.title: Zero Trust Customer Stories: Two years of Securing Remote Work with Cloudflare and OneTrust
nodes.description:
Two years into the global pandemic, and the stakes for remote work security have never been higher.  Even as ransomware, phishing, and shadow IT reach all-time highs, admins must ensure users stay safe and productive across all devices, apps, and locations.

As work-from-home flexibility settles in as the new normal, Cloudflare has seen organizations start to re-evaluate the temporary IT scaffolding they put in place in early 2020. For many, this has meant taking steps towards more sustainable and secure Internet-native Zero Trust architectures.

In this webinar, Cloudflare and special guest, Colin Henderson, VP of Information Security at OneTrust, will share lessons learned evolving their remote work security over the past two years. Tune in to learn how organizations:

  • Prioritize starting points to address remote work security problems
  • Balance user experience with more rigorous security
  • Motivate Zero Trust initiatives within their organization

filters.name: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce

nodes.title: The biggest application attacks of 2022 - and the modern defenses to stop them
nodes.description:
We have moved well beyond the familiar OWASP top ten attacks of the past to now witness attackers exploit global vulnerabilities, target APIs often with bots.  Bots make up close to 40 percent of traffic and now demand dedicated security to keep them from overwhelming sites.

We’ll examine insights about application attacks in 2022 from the vantage point of our network and show the integrated security necessary to keep this broad array of attacks from slowing business or distracting IT teams.

nodes.title: Integrated security for application attacks in 2022
nodes.description:
Attackers zero in on applications because they are the lifeblood of many businesses. But gone are the days of only having to worry about SQLi or cross-site scripting attacks. Today, application security must address credential stuffing, block emerging exploits against vulnerabilities like Log4j, and keep bot attacks at bay, all while preventing API abuse.  

Application security must not only account for all these attacks — but it also must do so without overwhelming IT and security teams with disparate products and interfaces. 

Join us to hear what integrated application security looks like in 2022 and what application security threats your IT team should be focused on:

  • Block application attacks
  • Keep Bots at bay
  • Protect APIs
  • Stop script attacks
  • Implement advanced DDoS protection
  • and more

nodes.title: Preparing your web application for unexpected traffic spikes (EMEA)
nodes.description:
Everyone wants a fast user experience for their web application. Yet many factors can stand in the way, including origin server outages and network latency in different global regions. And that’s not to mention sudden traffic spikes. Too many users can overwhelm your applications and infrastructure, leading to slow performance or downtime. 

‘Too many users’ is of course a great problem to have — but how do you ensure your applications are resilient in the face of increased traffic?

Cloudflare Load Balancing and Waiting Room help customers maintain high availability and resiliency with lightning fast performance — even in peak traffic scenarios. 

In this webinar, learn about:

  • What is Load Balancing, and how does it help with application availability?
  • How you can protect your origin server from sudden traffic spikes while also ensuring fast end-user experience (that’s also consistent with your brand).
  • How you can build highly available applications with fast performance built-in.

  • How you can build highly available applications with fast performance built-in.

nodes.title: A new DDoS attack vector for volumetric attacks (EMEA)
nodes.description:
A new zero-day vulnerability has been discovered that can be exploited to launch disruptive DDoS attacks using UDP amplification. This attack vector is in many ways more severe than memcached, allowing large scale reflection and amplification attacks to be launched against IP targets. Join this webinar where Cloudflare engineers will discuss the technique and defenses to protect your networks against amplification DDoS attacks.

In this webinar, you will learn about:

  • amplification DDoS attacks
  • how the zero-day vulnerability can be exploited
  • steps to protect your networks and telephony systems

nodes.title: Product Chats: What's New for API Security (Mandarin)
nodes.description: Wednesday, March 30th - 10:00 AM CST // Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including February's feature on API Security.

nodes.title: Shining a light on shadow APIs (EMEA)
nodes.description:
API-related traffic represents almost 54% of the world’s Internet traffic. Thus, APIs play a vital role in an organization’s digital transformation journey. But increased API use and functionality also contribute to visibility challenges and a growing attack surface.

Shadow or rogue APIs exist outside an organization’s official security and operational processes. Security teams can’t protect what they can’t see, making shadow APIs a prime target for attackers. Gaining visibility into API endpoints should be foundational to any API security strategy.

Join this webinar to hear Cloudflare security experts discuss:

  • The good and bad behind API growth
  • How shadow APIs are vulnerable to multiple OWASP Top 10 risks
  • How to gain API visibility without burdening the security team

  • How shadow APIs are vulnerable to multiple OWASP Top 10 risks
  • How to gain API visibility without burdening the security team

nodes.title: Product Chats: What's New for API Security (AMER/EMEA)
nodes.description: EMEA: Thursday, March 24th - 3:00 PM GMT // Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including February's feature on API Security.

nodes.title: Stopping Credential Stuffing and other Bot Attacks
nodes.description:
Malicious bots make up a growing portion of internet traffic. As we know, those bots have an insatiable appetite for attacks, among the most noteworthy being credential stuffing.
Register for our live webinar where Cloudflare’s Jamal Boutkabout, Partner Solutions Engineer take a look at the state of bot traffic and credential stuffing. 

In this live webinar, you will learn: 

  • How Cloudflare provides real-time visibility into bot traffic and trends
  • The latest bot activity trends as seen by the Cloudflare global network
  • How Cloudflare provides easy filtering on multiple dimensions of data, directly within our dashboard
  • How to use Bot Analytics to effectively visualize bot traffic and create policies to block bad bots

nodes.title: Product Chats: What's New for API Security (AMER/APJC)
nodes.description: APJC: Thursday, March 24th - 9:00 AM SGT // Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including February's feature on API Security.

Join this webinar where Cloudflare engineers will discuss the technique and defenses to protect your networks against amplification DDoS attacks.

In this webinar, you will learn about:

  • amplification DDoS attacks
  • how the zero-day vulnerability can be exploited
  • steps to protect your networks and telephony systems

nodes.title: Secure your future: Internet-native architecture helps you transform your business faster
nodes.description:
You’re grappling with apps moving to the cloud, teams working remotely, and an endlessly growing variety of security threats. To deal with this new reality, you’re looking at new security models and network architectures like zero trust and SASE. There’s no doubt those approaches will be very beneficial for tackling today’s tough security challenges. But what about tomorrow’s? Because when it comes to security, there’s no single destination. We simply can't know what new threats will emerge, how much scale will be required, and what new capabilities will be essential. 


Simply put, when it comes to connecting and securing your organization, today's vision is tomorrow's legacy. This means the biggest risk is committing to an approach that locks you out of your own future. There’s no reason to drag your vendors’ legacy forward, or restrict your options because of choices someone else made years ago. You need highly effective security that delivers a direct path to your next destination via an Internet-native architecture that delivers a rapid pace of innovation.

Join this vendor-agnostic session to learn about:

  • Why shifting your network and security infrastructure to the cloud and consolidating it into one composable services platform is happening now.
  • How to evaluate if a security platform is built on a trusted, resilient, and flexible zero trust network, architected for where networking is going.
  • How to adopt everything you need today and tomorrow to secure your business as a service so you can operate it easily, at your own pace, at lower cost, and with relentless innovation to help you change faster.

nodes.title: Magic Firewall: Harnessing cloud-native security
nodes.description:
Cloudflare Magic Firewall replaces security appliances with cloud-native firewall-as-a-service. With Magic Firewall, you can enforce consistent security policies globally through a common dashboard and filter unwanted traffic before it touches your network. 

In this webinar you will learn:

  • differences between firewall appliances and cloud-native firewall-as-a-service
  • design options for integrating firewall-as-a-service into your network architecture
  • what Magic Firewall looks like in action

Our experts will discuss how firewall-as-a-service solves problems common to firewall appliances, such as difficulty with scaling as your business grows, downtime during upgrades, and network choke points.

nodes.title: Securing branch office connectivity
nodes.description:
Magic WAN, the connectivity foundation of Cloudflare One, is a comprehensive, cloud-based network-as-a-service solution that is designed to be secure, fast, and reliable by default.

It replaces a patchwork of appliances and expensive, proprietary circuits with a single global network.

nodes.title: Sécurisez vos applications contre les vulnérabilités "Zero-Day" - Découvrez quels sont vos vecteurs d'attaques
nodes.description:
Inscrivez-vous à notre webinaire où Venceslas Devillard, Ingénieur Avant-vente et Jean-Charles Dubreucq, Commercial Grands comptes, vous feront découvrir: 

  • Comment Cloudflare offre une visibilité en temps réel sur le trafic et les tendances des attaques
  • Les règles gérées de Cloudflare offrent des protections avancées contre les vulnérabilités « zero-day ».
  • Les règles OWASP essentielles qui permlettent de bloquer  les techniques d’attaque répertoriées par le classement « Top 10 ».
  • L'ensemble de règles personnalisables offrant des protections sur mesure pour bloquer l'ensemble des menaces
  • Comment Cloudflare fournit des politiques de sécurité au sein d'un tableau de bord unique

Join us to hear what integrated application security looks like in 2022 and what application security threats your IT team should be focused on.

nodes.title: Defending US Critical Infrastructure with Zero Trust Cybersecurity
nodes.description:
In response to the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Agency’s (CISA) “Shields Up” advisory, Cloudflare, CrowdStrike, and Ping Identity have joined forces to strengthen cybersecurity for US public utilities & healthcare companies.

Join our webinar on March 10 at 9am Pacific to learn more about the phased milestones we'll help you achieve in just hours and days to improve your cyber security posture — at no-cost for four months.

filters.name: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce

nodes.title: 악성 봇으로부터 API 및 온라인 비즈니스 보호
nodes.description:
Cloudflare에 따르면 봇은 언제든 인터넷 트래픽의 40~50%를 차지하고, 세계 인터넷 트래픽 중 거의 60%가 API 관련 트래픽입니다. 악성 봇과 API 남용 모두 대부분의 온라인 기업에 영향을 미치고, 결국 기업 웹 응용 프로그램의 데이터 유출을 가져옵니다. 

따라서 최신 응용 프로그램 보안 전략은 봇 관리와 API 보안을 반드시 고려해야 합니다. 당사 웨비나에 참여해 주요 봇 및 API 보안 위험과 이를 방지하기 위해 필요한 보호 기능은 어떤 것인지 알아보세요.  

본 웨비나의 내용:

  • 2021년 응용 프로그램을 지원하는 API의 현황
  • 데이터 유출로 이어지는 API 보안 위험
  • 고려해야 하는 API 보안의 중요 5개 계층 
  • Cloudflare 계층형 봇 방어 소개
  • Cloudflare Bot Analytics 사용에 관한 인사이트

nodes.title: Getting the best from Page Shield
nodes.description:
Page Shield does not require any additional configuration AND offers fast detection, prevention and mitigation capabilities. 

You can also enable email alerts to make sure you are protected from attacks, including adware, ransomware and crypto mining.

nodes.title: Superpowers for SaaS Providers
nodes.description:
SaaS Providers face many challenges to successfully scale a great SaaS business in 2022.

Be it great online experiences with blazing fast performance or strong threat protection and data security that has become table stakes, it can be tough to address everything a SaaS business needs to scale with lean teams. Requirements range from TLS certificates to application scalability to fast global performance -- in addition to everything else needed to drive the business forward.

Join us as we discuss how Cloudflare makes life easier for fast growing SaaS companies with Cloudflare for SaaS. Cloudflare arms providers small and large with superpowers that allow for fast, seamless global web performance, strong security and unparalleled scalability.

nodes.title: Expanding Zero Trust with email security
nodes.description:
In today’s digital and distributed workplace, phishing, business email compromise (BEC), and other targeted email attacks remain more frequent and dangerous than ever. The FBI received ~240,000 complaints on phishing and related attacks in 2020, a 110% increase from 2019 numbers.

Targeted email attacks continue to evade existing email security controls and exploit trusted relationships to remain undetected. Cloudflare has announced its intent to acquire Area 1 Security, a leading cloud-native email security platform, to keep employees safe and productive regardless of where they work or the applications they access.

Join the Cloudflare and Area 1 teams in this webinar to:

  • Learn the latest trends on phishing, BEC, and other targeted email attacks
  • Study how email attacks get past existing email security controls by exploiting trust
  • Learn why Cloudflare sees email security as a critical part of a Zero Trust security posture 
  • Observe Area 1 technology in action as it preemptively stops phishing across email, web, and network environments

nodes.title: Demystifying SASE for CIOs and tech leaders: Solutions and strategies for security modernization
nodes.description:
SASE is generating tremendous hype, steep expectations, and confusion. Ideally, SASE promises to deliver benefits such as consistent protection, reduced complexity, and scalability. But modern enterprise networks are a maze of complexity including distributed networks, specialized systems, legacy infrastructure, public and private cloud, and dozens of security tools from multiple vendors. While enterprise buyers require a common visibility and policy framework, how can they approach the SASE transformation in a way that best aligns with their security requirements and business goals?

In this presentation, we will play a recorded video with IDC analyst and Cloudflare Subject Matter Expert to explore the SASE concept and examine strategies to help IT buyers navigate the SASE journey. A live Q&A will be hosted at the end of presentation to answer all your questions about SASE.

nodes.title: Product Chats: What's New for Cloudflare Images & WAF (Mandarin)
nodes.description: Monday, February 28 ⋅ 2:00 PM CST  // Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including February's feature on Cloudflare Images & WAF.

nodes.title: Product Chats: What's New for Cloudflare Images & WAF (EMEA/APJC)
nodes.description: APJC: Thursday, February 24 ⋅ 4:00 PM SGT  // Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including February's feature on Cloudflare Images & WAF.

nodes.title: Advanced demo: Cloudflare's Zero Trust platform
nodes.description:
The shift to remote work continues to highlight significant security gaps for organizations of all sizes. Outdated infrastructure and lenient access controls bottleneck performance, while employees use unmanaged devices and unsecured networks to connect to sensitive resources.

Securing the corporate network requires a Zero Trust strategy — one that enables organizations to streamline and manage access control for remote employees, restrict lateral movement within the network, and stay ahead of browser-based threats.

That’s where Cloudflare Zero Trust comes in. Cloudflare combines ZTNA, Secure Web Gateway (SWG), and Remote Browser Isolation (RBI) into a unified, natively-integrated experience. Traffic is verified, filtered, inspected, and isolated from threats as users connect through Cloudflare’s global network — spanning 250+ locations around the world.

Cloudflare Zero Trust is a rapidly evolving platform, and we’re continuing to add features that enable more granular control over your infrastructure. Watch our new Zero Trust demo and learn how to:

  • Configure advanced functions like tenant control, private DNS resolution, and full platform automation
  • Reduce reliance on VPNs with the WARP client
  • Filter DNS, HTTP, and L4 network requests with Gateway
  • Secure access for web and non-web applications
  • Seamlessly scale remote browser isolation

filters.name: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce

nodes.title: Product Chats: What's New for Cloudflare Images & WAF (AMER/EMEA)
nodes.description: EMEA: Wednesday, February 23 ⋅ 5:00pm-6:00pm GMT // Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including February's feature on Cloudflare Images & WAF.

nodes.title: 2021 DDoS attack trends: Year in review
nodes.description:
2021 was an exceptionally busy year for attackers — and Q4’21 led the charge in terms of the number of attacks observed. For example, December 2021 alone recorded more attacks than all of those observed in either of the first two quarters of the year. 

From record-breaking volumetric DDoS attacks launched by historically large swarms of botnets, to massive ransomware and ransom DDoS campaigns that interrupted aspects of critical infrastructure around the world, DDoS was the focal point of network security for many organizations in 2021.

As attackers continue to evolve their techniques and get more brazen with their attacks, how can organizations protect their network infrastructure?

Join this webinar to learn about:

• Q4’21 DDoS trends (with a look back on some major DDoS events)

• Ransom DDoS attacks: what are they and how can you stay protected?

• What organizations can do to make the impact of DDoS attacks a thing of the past

nodes.title: Employees are exhausted: how Zero Trust security can actually help
nodes.description:
The balance between security and user experience is a classic IT/security tale. Improvements to one create detrimental effects to the other, the story used to go—but the storyline hasn’t aged very well.

When Zero Trust principles are implemented effectively, they can actually improve employee experiences with simpler access and better peace of mind when browsing the open internet. When employees leave feedback on why they love their job, let’s just say clunky VPNs and catch-all firewall rules typically don’t make the list.

Join us in this workplace experience discussion that details both the HR and IT/Security perspective. We’ll discuss:

  • What does it mean to have a great employee experience?
  • Why is that more important than ever in the current hiring environment? 
  • What does effective and safe remote onboarding look like?
  • How can Zero Trust practices help?

filters.name: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce

nodes.title: Enhanced DDoS Protection with Cloudflare and Console Connect
nodes.description:
Businesses everywhere are increasingly reliant on secure and reliable Internet. Yet growing security threats, such as ransom DDoS attacks, make your business increasingly vulnerable to service interruptions.

Cloudflare Network Interconnect (CNI) now integrates Console Connect's global Network-as-a-Service (NaaS) platform with industry-leading security from Cloudflare, reducing latency, increasing reliability, and protecting your networks and applications against DDoS threats. With fast provisioning and software-defined virtual connections, CNI helps you quickly enable services, such as Magic Transit and Magic Firewall, and deploy scalable security-as-a-service globally.

Your privacy is important to us.  Click here to learn more about our privacy policy.

#CALENDARREMINDER#

nodes.description:
Malicious bots make up a growing portion of internet traffic. As we know, those bots have an insatiable appetite for attacks, among the most noteworthy being credential stuffing.

Register for our on-demand webinar where Cloudflare’s Dan Gould, Product Marketing and Neil Patel, Technical Marketing, take a look at the state of bot traffic and credential stuffing. 

In this webinar, you will learn: 

  • How Cloudflare provides real-time visibility into bot traffic and trends
  • The latest bot activity trends as seen by the Cloudflare global network
  • How Cloudflare provides easy filtering on multiple dimensions of data, directly within our dashboard
  • How to use Bot Analytics to effectively visualize bot traffic and create policies to block bad bots

nodes.title: Enabling scalable security for remote access to internal resources
nodes.description:
Enabling scalable security for remote access to internal resources

In a world where competitiveness relies upon mobility and remote work, Zero Trust strategy is critical for safeguarding productivity and innovation, especially when it comes to creating and/or supporting the next big blockbuster games. 

Watch this on-demand webinar with Cloudflare Zero Trust and Network Security specialist Joshua Watts and Botir Bayzakov, Sales Leader Strategic Enterprise - Gaming to hear:

  • How Zero Trust can help you innovate faster 
  • Few easy steps to implement cost effective Zero Trust at scale
  • Why traditional network architecture strategies no longer protect users or data
  • Insights on how Zero Trust and SASE simplifies network infrastructure
  • Unintended benefits your company will acquire by implementing Zero Trust

nodes.title: What's new in Zero Trust services
nodes.description:
Cloudflare is launching a regular cadence of informative webinars focussing on the most recent developments in Zero Trust services. The series, which is only available to Cloudflare customers, starts in January and then every 3 months thereafter.

During this inaugural session we will be looking deeper into some of Cloudflare’s recent Zero Trust innovations including;

  • Zero Trust Private Network Sessions
  • Role Based Access Control in the Teams dash
  • Device posture rules and many others

nodes.title: Verbinden und Schützen Sie Unternehmensnetzwerke mit Magic Transit und Magic WAN incl. Demo
nodes.description:
Anwendungen und Netzwerke, die mit dem Internet verbunden sind, werden ständig von Botnets und anderem bösartigen Datenverkehr angegriffen. Herkömmliche appliance-basierte Sicherheitsdienste können mit dem wachsenden Bandbreitenbedarf nicht Schritt halten.

Cloudflare Magic Transit ist eine Cloud-native Netzwerksicherheitslösung, die DDoS-Angriffe und anderen bösartigen Datenverkehr stoppt, bevor sie Ihr Netzwerk erreichen. Zusammen mit Magic WAN kann es Ihre Rechenzentren, Cloud-Dienste und physischen Standorte sicher miteinander verbinden, ohne den Datenverkehr durch Sicherheitsschleusen zu leiten, die die Leistung von Anwendungen beeinträchtigen können.

In diesem Webinar und der Live-Demo erfahren Sie:
- Wie Magic Transit und Magic WAN funktionieren
- Die Vorteile von Magic Transit gegenüber herkömmlichen DDoS-Schutzlösungen
- Ihre architektonischen Optionen zur Integration von Magic Transit und Magic WAN in Ihr Netzwerk oder in öffentliche Cloud-Dienste

nodes.title: Five security keys for protecting APIs
nodes.description:
APIs are a growing part of doing business today. While they enable innovation, APIs also introduce a host of new security risks. Thus, modern application security strategies must account for API security.

Join our webinar to learn about key API security risks and the protections you need to defend against them. 

In this webinar, you will learn about:

  • The state of APIs driving applications in 2021
  • The API security risks contributing to breaches
  • Five important layers of API security to consider 
  • How Cloudflare API Shield keeps APIs productive and secure

nodes.title: Five security keys for protecting APIs
Product Chats: What's New for Teams & Cloudflare Network? (Mandarin)
nodes.description: Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including December's feature on Teams & Cloudflare Network. This session will be hosted in Mandarin.

nodes.title: BlockFi's security evolution: Lessons in hyperscaling with CSO Adam Healy
nodes.description:
Leveling up security to match an organization’s growth is a fundamental challenge for any new CIO or CSO. That task is even tougher while triaging live cyber attacks.

BlockFi’s Chief Security Officer Adam Healy knows this problem all too well. Since its founding in 2017, BlockFi, a wealth management platform powered by blockchain technology, has rapidly expanded its client base, assets under management, and employees. To support that hyperscaling, BlockFi has evolved its security approach, shifting controls to the cloud and adopting Zero Trust for its remote-first workforce.

Join Adam in a conversation with Cloudflare’s Sam Rhea (Director, Product Management) held during our recent CIO Week as they discuss how BlockFI approaches scaling security. Specifically, Adam shares lessons in how he coaches and structures his security organization (9:30), how BlockFi navigated attacks on its public-facing Internet infrastructure (15:00), and how Zero Trust is essential to BlockFi’s security going forward (18:45).

nodes.title: Log4j: What to know and how to stay safe
nodes.description:
The Log4j vulnerability has suddenly dominated headlines — and a week of rapid security responses, given its critical nature. Join our brief webinar to learn:
  • How attacks exploit the Log4j vulnerability
  • How logging systems are vulnerable
  • Cloudflare insights into global attacker exploit trends 
  • How to understand an organization's exposure
  • Recommended mitigations

nodes.title: The Journey to Zero Trust in ANZ and SEA
nodes.description:
The impact on business of a global pandemic and the effect this has had on IT security and infrastructure present new challenges for organizations. Cloudflare wanted to understand these challenges, how organizations dealt with these challenges with regards to IT security and infrastructure, and how this is likely to affect these areas in the future. Cloudflare also wanted to determine the understanding around Zero Trust as an approach to IT security, whether and how this framework was rolled out by organizations, and the perceived benefits that this provided.

Cloudflare commissioned research with The Leading Edge across five countries in APAC — Australia, India, Japan, Malaysia, and Singapore — with IT and cybersecurity decision-makers and influencers in order to understand these areas. In this webinar, we’ll present the findings of that research and how organisations can deal with these challenges moving forward.

nodes.description:
Наши технические эксперты расскажут вам о возможностях Cloudflare в направлении SASE (технология безопасного пограничного доступа) с проведением демонстрации и поделятся опытом внедрения решения.

Вебинар покроет следующие темы:

  • Zero Trust технология от Cloudflare 
  • Защита корпоративных устройств от различных онлайн угроз
  • Изоляция веб браузера 
  • Защита автономной системы / наземной инфраструктуры

В конце вебинара для самых внимательных слушателей мы разыграем подарки.

nodes.title: Cómo Cloudflare ha mejorado la protección online de Telefónica
nodes.description:
Acerca de este Webinar

Telefónica Tech forma parte de la estrategia de Telefónica para acompañar a los clientes su transformación digital proporcionando servicios digitales como Ciberseguridad, Cloud, IoT y Big Data a todos sus clientes. Cuando necesitaron mejorar el alcance y la eficiencia del monitoreo de ataques, así como la velocidad del website, Telefónica Tech trabajó con Cloudflare. Regístrese para este online webinar con el Cybersecurity Specialist de Telefonica Tech, Jesús Muñoz Largo, para una discusión emocionante donde escuchará:

Agenda

  • Cómo Cloudflare ayudó a detectar y detener más de 20.000 amenazas de TelefonicaTech en un mes
  • Cómo Telefónica Tech aumentó la velocidad de acceso a los recursos web en más de un 59%
  • Formas de mejorar su estrategia de ciberseguridad y transformación digital en 2022

nodes.title: Ransom DDoS, Meris botnet, and the latest DDoS attack trends
nodes.description:
The third quarter of 2021 was an exceptionally busy time for attackers. Cloudflare observed and mitigated record-setting HTTP DDoS attacks, terabit-strong network-layer attacks, one of the largest botnets ever deployed (Meris), and more recently, ransom DDoS attacks targeting Voice over IP (VoIP) service providers around the world.

How do organizations ensure that their Internet assets are protected against threats of any size or kind?

In this webinar, you’ll learn about:

  • Key DDoS attack trends from Q3 2021
  • Ransom DDoS threats — and what you can do if you are affected
  • How to make the impact of DDoS attacks a thing of the past

nodes.title: Kentik Network Observability and Advanced DDoS Protection from Cloudflare
nodes.description:
DDoS attacks continue to hit the frontlines of network security. Application-layer attacks are skyrocketing, with the largest ever attack reported in August at 17.2M rps. In Q3, Cloudflare also detected a rise in network-layer (L3/4) DDoS attacks by 44% worldwide compared to previous quarters. Kentik detects attacks with greater accuracy across a broad range of infrastructure and telemetry formats. Partnering with Cloudflare provides over 100 Tbps of DDoS protection capacity in 250+ data centers across more than 100 countries.

In this webinar, you’ll learn how the combined solution of Cloudflare Magic Transit and Kentik can help overcome these obstacles, while protecting your applications and ensuring overall service availability.
These come together in a SaaS based solution that provides fast, automated mitigation of distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks.

You’ll leave with a roadmap on the offering, including:

  • Quick deployment and best in-class network infrastructure protection
  • Traffic inspection and real-time attack detection
  • Notification and signalling of attacks
  • Automatic mitigation of malicious traffic
  • Improvements in network operations outcomes

#CALENDARREMINDER#

nodes.title: Cloudflare Threat Insights: Intelligence From the Criminal Underground Integrated Across Our Global Network with Intel471
nodes.description:
Organizations rely on intelligence from security vendors like Cloudflare to protect their workforces and networks from Internet threats. But malware and specifically, ransomware families, are only growing in prevalence and sophistication. 

Staying on top of the shifting landscape of malware and ransomware requires partnerships with the right experts and wide visibility across Internet traffic.

In this webinar, Cloudflare threat insights: Intelligence from the criminal underground integrated across our global network, you’ll learn how Cloudflare stays on top of the shifting landscape of malware and leverages insights from research partners like Intel471.

We’ll cover:

  • How Cloudflare and Intel471 work together to track the evolution of malware families
  • How research firms like Intel471 identify risky domains and IPs -- so your security teams do not have to
  • How aggregating and activating threat intelligence across Cloudflare’s global network protects organizations

nodes.title: Demo trực tuyến: Cách chặn các cuộc tấn công phức tạp từ Bot
nodes.description:
Tại Cloudflare, chúng tôi nhận thấy rằng rất nhiều doanh nghiệp thường không biết rằng họ có các vấn đề về Bot, hoặc ít nhất các doanh nghiệp đều không rõ về lượng Bot thường xuyên vào các ứng dụng/website public của họ. 

Hiện nay Bot chiếm tầm 40-50% lượng traffic trên internet mỗi ngày. Chúng chậm rãi can thiệp vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của doanh nghiệp, làm quá tải hệ thống, đánh cắp các thông tin đăng nhập, thông tin thẻ tín dụng, đặt hàng ảo hoặc đứng đằng sau các cuộc tấn công đánh cắp dữ liệu. 

Hãy tham gia vào buổi demo trực tuyến của Cloudflare để hiểu rõ hơn về việc phát hiện Bot, chặn Bot phức tạp trong real time, sử dụng máy học, phân tích hành vi và nhiều công cụ cao cấp khác thuộc giải pháp Bot Management của Cloudflare.

Thời gian: Thứ 5, ngày 25 tháng 11 lúc 2 giờ chiều (GMT + 7)

nodes.title: Product Chats: What's New for Full Stack week? (Mandarin)
nodes.description: Cloudflare is always innovating to bring our customers new products and features. Join Cloudflare's Product Managers each month to hear the latest highlights, including November's insight into our Full Stack Week. This session will be hosted in Mandarin.

nodes.title: Connect users, applications, and branch offices in a work-from-anywhere world
nodes.description:
When COVID-19 forced an overnight transition to remote work, businesses scrambled to keep employees connected. The most common approaches — like increasing VPN appliance capacity, and split-tunneling — are starting to show their cracks, as familiar challenges with visibility, security and complexity persist. 

Now, it's the time to re-think your approach to build a long-term infrastructure strategy that connects remote workforce to resources simply and securely with no VPN. Block lateral movement, ransomware, malware, and phishing.

Please join us to know more about Cloudflare's answer to Secure Access Service Edge (SASE), Cloudflare One, by combining network connectivity services with Zero Trust security services on a purpose-built global network. You can replace expensive, proprietary circuits with a single global network that provides built-in Zero Trust functionality, DDoS mitigation, network firewalling, and traffic acceleration in one unified platform.

nodes.title: APAC Design workshop: Connect and protect enterprise networks with Magic Transit and Magic WAN
nodes.description:
Internet-facing apps and networks are constantly under attack from botnets and other malicious traffic. Traditional appliance-based security services struggle to keep up with growing bandwidth needs.

Cloudflare Magic Transit is a cloud-native network security solution that stops DDoS attacks and other malicious traffic before they reach your network. Along with Magic WAN, it can securely interconnect your data centers, cloud services, and physical locations without tromboning traffic through security choke points that can degrade app performance.

In this webinar and live demo, you will discover:

- How Magic Transit and Magic WAN work
- The advantages of Magic Transit against traditional DDoS protection solutions
- Your architectural options to integrate Magic Transit and Magic WAN with your network or public cloud services

nodes.title: Advanced application security services & API shield
nodes.description:
Cloudflare‘s application security portfolio keeps applications and APIs secure and productive, thwarts DDoS attacks, keeps bots at bay, detects anomalies and malicious payloads, all while monitoring for browser supply chain attacks.

During this webinar we will cover the latest platform of features from Cloudflare designed specifically for API’s.

nodes.title: Zero Trust controls for your SaaS applications
nodes.description:
You can now bring the Zero Trust security features of Cloudflare Access to your SaaS applications. You can protect any SaaS application that can integrate with a SAML identity provider with Cloudflare Access.

Even though that SaaS application is not deployed on Cloudflare, we can still add security rules to every login. In this session we'll walkthrough setting up a SaaS application, configuring Zero Trust policies to protect the application and using Gateway to protect specific data in the SaaS application.

nodes.title: What bot attacks look like -- and how to stop them
nodes.description:
What bot attacks look like -- and how to stop them

On any given day, bots make up 40-50% of internet traffic. They get in the way of business, overload backend resources and carry out credential and credit card stuffing, inventory hoarding and data scraping attacks. What’s more, the attackers behind bots constantly update their attack platforms to quickly circumvent manual IP blocklisting and user-agent filtering.

This is why organizations need sophisticated Bot Management solutions, with layered detections to stop bots in their tracks. 

In the spirit of separating good bots from bad, we’ve enlisted Dan Gould and Neil Patel from Cloudflare to show what bot activity looks like -- and the required detection layers to stop them. Join us for a demo presentation of Cloudflare’s Bot Management Solution to see how it spots and stops sophisticated bots in real time using heuristics, machine learning and anomaly detection. 

In this webinar, you will learn:

  • The latest bot activity trends as seen by the Cloudflare global network
  • How Cloudflare provides real-time visibility into bot traffic 
  • How Cloudflare provides easy filtering on multiple dimensions of data, directly within our dashboard
  • How to use Bot Analytics to effectively visualize bot traffic and create policies to block bad bots

nodes.title: Cloudflare for Teams demo: Secure your perimeter with Zero Trust
nodes.description:
Now more than ever, organizations need to evaluate and modernize their approach to network and application security. With many employees using unmanaged devices and connecting over unsecured networks, security gaps and performance bottlenecks have become commonplace. 

Cloudflare for Teams addresses these challenges with a single-pass architecture, where all workforce traffic is verified, filtered, inspected, and isolated from threats through Cloudflare’s global edge network.

Join our demo of the end user experience and walk through use cases like:

  • Configuring client and clientless secure access for web and non-web applications 
  • Setting up access controls: from user authentication and device posture to DNS, HTTP, and network filters
  • Implementing threat and data protection controls with Browser Isolation
  • Detecting and cataloging Shadow IT — and more

nodes.title: Building an Enhanced Internet Edge with PacketFabric and Cloudflare Magic Transit
nodes.description:
Building an Enhanced Internet Edge with PacketFabric and Cloudflare Magic Transit

The Internet is your new corporate network. However, the Internet was never designed to be secure, private or predictable, which imposes operational challenges and results in a poor experience for your customers, employees and partners.

In this webinar, you’ll learn how to overcome these obstacles and risks with a new Internet edge architecture. You’ll leave with a roadmap on how to:

  • Build a new enhanced Internet edge architecture
  • Reduce security risks from DDoS attacks
  • Ensure predictable application performance
  • Connect flexibly to data centers, cloud service providers and enterprise SaaS
  • Deliver optimal user experiences

Your privacy is important to Cloudflare and PacketFabric.  Click here to learn more about Cloudflare's privacy policy.

#CALENDARREMINDER#

nodes.title: The Internet Is The New Corporate Network - Security and WAN Architectures for a Hybrid Future
nodes.description:
What is the role of the WAN in the hybrid work-from-anywhere era? As applications have moved to SaaS and hybrid cloud and users have moved away from offices, the traditional hub & spoke model is showing its age. While SD-WANs have given enterprises more flexibility, security requirements often require performance and architectural tradeoffs. View this webinar to learn how modern network-as-a-service and security-as-a-service architectures ensure security for your apps and users without compromising performance.

What You Will Learn:

  • Evolving security and performance requirements for modern applications
  • Pros and cons of MPLS, IPSec VPNs and SD-WAN
  • Integrated network-as-a-service and security-as-a-service architectures that avoid tradeoffs between security and performance
